results.abstract: 37-lb male chimpanzee nicknamed Ham survives 18-min, 420-mi flight over Caribbean from Canaveral in test of Mercury space capsule; in good condition when capsule is pulled from water 3 hrs after launching; data indicate he reacted well and was able to operate levers as trained; capsule rose 155 mi, 40 more than planned, and overshot target by 130 mi; test seen success except for overshooting and loss of heat shield in water; Ham's preparation for launching described; illus; map

headline.main: Space Chimpanzee Is Safe After Soaring 420 Miles; Ape Survives a Space Flight in a Mercury Capsule Chimpanzee Soars 420 Miles And Survives in a Space Test

results.snippet: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Jan. 31 -- A male chimpanzee nicknamed "Ham" was rocketed 420 miles over the Caribbean today in a test of the Mercury capsule that is scheduled to carry a human astronaut into orbit.

byline.original: By RICHARD WITKIN Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Jan. 31 -- A male chimpanzee nicknamed "Ham" was rocketed 420 miles over the Caribbean today in a test of the Mercury capsule that is scheduled to carry a human astronaut into orbit.

results.abstract: Ham refuses to pose in space harness, news conf; Lt Col Henry says life-support system and sensors worked well; sees human able to take trip; notes Ham performed well and heartbeat was normal except for brief periods of maximum stress during take-off acceleration and reentry

headline.main: Space Chimpanzee Bars Encore; Refuses to Pose in His Harness

results.snippet: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Feb. 3 (AP) -- A medical expert said today that man could have survived the space ride taken by Ham, the space chimpanzee. But the freckle-faced ape indicated at a news conference that he had some unpleasant memories of the...
results.lead_paragraph: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Feb. 3 (AP) -- A medical expert said today that man could have survived the space ride taken by Ham, the space chimpanzee. But the freckle-faced ape indicated at a news conference that he had some unpleasant memories of the trip.

headline.main: 9,000 Companies Helped Ham, the Chimp, Into Space; 9,000 COMPANIES GIVE HAM A LIFT

results.snippet: An arm of the Government, the country's best engineers, more than 9,000 business organizations and almost $300,000,000 combined to hurl Ham into space.
results.lead_paragraph: An arm of the Government, the country's best engineers, more than 9,000 business organizations and almost $300,000,000 combined to hurl Ham into space.

headline.main: SOVIET LAUNCHES 7.1-TON SATELLITE WITH NEW ROCKET; Sputnik V Is Put Into Orbit -- No Indication Given of Anything Alive Aboard WEIGHT A SPACE RECORD Moscow Tells Few Details Beyond Reporting Vehicle Did All Assigned Jobs SOVIET LAUNCHES 7.1-TON SATELLITE

results.snippet: MOSCOW, Feb. 4 -- The Soviet Union announced today it had put into orbit a huge earth satellite weighing more than seven tons.

byline.original: By OSGOOD CARUTHERSSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Feb. 4 -- The Soviet Union announced today it had put into orbit a huge earth satellite weighing more than seven tons.

headline.main: LABOR IN STATE PRODS CONGRESS; Urges Delegation to Support White House Program to Stimulate Economy

results.snippet: Organized labor in this state has begun to lobby actively for Congressional approval of President Kennedy's economic program.
results.lead_paragraph: Organized labor in this state has begun to lobby actively for Congressional approval of President Kennedy's economic program.

results.snippet: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Feb. 18 (AP) -- A man-in-space capsule is about to receive its most severe test on a crucial flight that it must survive if a United States astronaut is to be put into orbit late this year.
results.lead_paragraph: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Feb. 18 (AP) -- A man-in-space capsule is about to receive its most severe test on a crucial flight that it must survive if a United States astronaut is to be put into orbit late this year.

headline.main: 3 Chosen for Space Flight In Two or Three Months; 3 CHOSEN BY U.S. FOR SPACE FLIGHT

results.snippet: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Feb. 21 -- Three candidates were selected today for a one-man flight into space expected within two or three months. The three were chosen from seven trained astronauts.
results.lead_paragraph: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Feb. 21 -- Three candidates were selected today for a one-man flight into space expected within two or three months. The three were chosen from seven trained astronauts.

results.snippet: During his five weeks in the White House President Kennedy has sent Congress more than a score of messages and draft bills setting out his legislative program. Last week he presented a major element of that program -- a $5.6 billion plan of Federal...
results.lead_paragraph: During his five weeks in the White House President Kennedy has sent Congress more than a score of messages and draft bills setting out his legislative program. Last week he presented a major element of that program -- a $5.6 billion plan of Federal aid to education.

headline.main: Scientists and Inventors: Lives With Meaning for Our Age

results.snippet: IN this new and golden age of science that looks to the astronaut, the atom and the rocket, there are still positive values for young readers in meeting scientists and inventors of the past. In so doing, the reader gains an increased appreciation of...
results.lead_paragraph: IN this new and golden age of science that looks to the astronaut, the atom and the rocket, there are still positive values for young readers in meeting scientists and inventors of the past. In so doing, the reader gains an increased appreciation of the extent to which today's scientific progress is based on the achievements of yesterday.
